title: References to federal statutes
context: [ยง485A-103] References to federal statutes. &ldquo;Securities Act of 1933&rdquo; (15 U.S.C. 77a et seq.), &ldquo;Securities Exchange Act of 1934&rdquo; (15 U.S.C. 78a et seq.), &ldquo;Public Utility Holding Company Act of 1935&rdquo; (15 U.S.C. 79 et seq.), &ldquo;Investment Company Act of 1940&rdquo; (15 U.S.C. 80a-1 et seq.), &ldquo;Investment Advisers Act of 1940&rdquo; (15 U.S.C. 80b-1 et seq.), &ldquo;Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974&rdquo; (29 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.), &ldquo;National Housing Act&rdquo; (12 U.S.C. 1701 et seq.), &ldquo;Commodity Exchange Act&rdquo; (7 U.S.C. 1 et seq.), &ldquo;Internal Revenue Code&rdquo; (26 U.S.C. 1 et seq.), &ldquo;Securities Investor Protection Act of 1970&rdquo; (15 U.S.C. 78aaa et seq.), &ldquo;Securities Litigation Uniform Standards Act of 1998&rdquo; (112 Stat. 3227), &ldquo;Small Business Investment Act of 1958&rdquo; (15 U.S.C. 661 et seq.), &ldquo;National Securities Markets Improvement Act of 1996&rdquo; (Pub. L. No. 104-290, 110 Stat. 3416 (1996)), and &ldquo;Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act&rdquo; (15 U.S.C. 7001 et seq.) mean those statutes and the rules and regulations adopted under those statutes, as in effect on July 1, 2008, or as later amended. [L 2006, c 229, pt of ยง1] Revision Note &ldquo;July 1, 2008&rdquo; substituted for &ldquo;the date of enactment of this chapter&rdquo;.
